messages.message:
Follow up on user research X case management
(Context:
on our last meeting I asked if we support use case we've seen in the user research session when a mortgage may have variable number of applicant -> we may want to have cross checks with their IDs (or other classes of documents). It appears that currently our case management implementation doesn't support such checks, as if a packet has several documents with the same class we select one as the main one and use it, so we can't do validation 7 mentioned people vs 7 IDs.)

It looks like a case we definitely want to support in the future. Do we have it on our roadmap? If not, do you mind if I create an entry in our backlog so we can include it in the next milestones/plans?

we don't currently have this on our roadmap

and yes, we should track this on the EPD board

@Kaustubh (KD) i think we should create a case management milestone 4 EPD ticket to track features that are not within milestones 1-3, which constitute the MVP for case management?

i think this use case (validating the ID of 1 applicant within 7 applicants in a packet) would be solved by intra-class field prioritization, which has also been requested by RSA (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C07AG807813/p1748850626472489)

after we allow more complex ways of handling multiple documents of the same class in a packet
-> you would create 1 cross-class field with all applicant names in the packet (or 1 field per applicant name)
-> create a validation rule to check that these names match the IDs provided in the packet

In this case, let me create a milestone 4 initiative. Honestly there are 3 main functions here:
• Intra-class prioritization defined by users 
• Primary key / unique id based case batching 
• Cross-class reasoning field

> • Primary key / unique id based case batching
> • Cross-class reasoning field
were these requested during other discussions with customers?
The last bullet has been the first one by a few but we don't do this with our use cases today so we can get away with that later.

so maybe just
• Intra-class prioritization defined by users
• Cross-class reasoning field
